# Richard Linklater’s ‘Nouvelle Vague’ Leads Nominations For France’s César Awards As Ceremony Date Change Announced

Richard Linklater’s Nouvelle Vague has topped the nominations for the 51st edition of France’s César awards.

Linklater’s ode to the French new wave Nouvelle Vague was nominated in 10 categories, including for Best Director and Best Film. [...] The nominations were unveiled Patrick Sobelman and Ariane Toscan du Plantier, presidents of the  Academy of Cinema Arts and Techniques, or César Academy, in Paris on Wednesday.

Just prior to revealing the nominations, the academy also announced it was moving the previously ceremony’s previously date to avoid clashing with a major televised charity event.

The awards will now take place on February 26, instead of February 27, at the l’Olympia concert hall in Paris, presided over by Camille Cottin and presented Benjamin Lavernhe with support from a variety of French cinema artists.

### Watch on Deadline

Jim Carrey will receive the honorary César this year.

More to follow…

data.title: Ana De Armas To Star As Fitness Influencer In J Blakeson’s AGC Studio-Backed Psychological Thriller ‘Sweat’ Based On Polish Cannes-Selected Hit - Deadline
data.snippet:
Ana de Armas has signed to star as rising fitness influencer Emma Kent who dreams of matching the success of her idol, social media superstar Kat Highbrook.

Her carefully curated world begins to collapse when an encounter with Kat goes horribly wrong, and she is forced into a dangerous arrangement with Trent, an obsessive fan. His unhinged devotion pushes her to choose how far she’s willing to go for fame.

### Related Stories

[News  

### AGC Studios Promotes Zach Garrett To Head Of Film](

[Agencies  

### Ana De Armas Signs With WME](

UK director, screenwriter and producer J Blakeson, whose past credits include Hulu-Disney+ series Culprits, Netflix hit I Care A Lot, The 5th Wave and neo-noir debut The Disappearance Of Alice Creed, will direct.

# Ana De Armas To Star As Fitness Influencer In J Blakeson’s AGC Studio-Backed Psychological Thriller ‘Sweat’ Based On Polish Cannes-Selected Hit

AGC Studios has boarded psychological thriller Sweat in a deal that will see it finance, co-produce and handle international sales on the production, based on Swedish Polish director Magnus von Horn’s Cannes-selected film of the same name. [...] Cuban-born, Blonde Oscar-nominated actress Ana de Armas is a coming off a high-profile 2025 which saw her hit the big screen in John Wick spin-off Ballerina and Ron Howard’s Eden.

De Armas is repped by WME, Kuranda Management, Bailey Brand Management, Wolf Kasteler Public Relations and Grubman Shire Meiselas & Sacks; Blakeson is repped by WME, David Higham Associates and Goodman, Genow, Schenkman, Smelkinson & Christopher.

The deal was negotiated by Christopher Tricarico of Tricarico Chavez LLPfor ROSTO Inc. and by Anant Tamirisa on behalf of AGC.

data.title: Berlinale Juries: ‘Rental Family’ Director Hikari; Producers Ewa Puszczyńska & Reinaldo Marcus Green Join Wim Wenders On Competition Jury - Deadline
data.snippet:
[News  

### Richard Linklater's 'Nouvelle Vague' Leads Nominations For France's César Awards As Ceremony Date Change Announced](

Paris, Texas, Wings of Desireand Perfect Days director and long-time Berlinale supporter Wenders was announced as the president of the jury in December.

### Watch on Deadline

The festival has also unveiled the members of the other juries across the 2026 selection including for Perspectives competition focused on first features which is in its second edition this year.

Directors Sofia Alaoui (Morocco), Frédéric Hambalek (Germany) and Dorota Lech (Poland / Canada) will decided the winner of the Best First Feature Award, which comes with a 50,000 euros cash prize, and is endowed by Germany’s Society for the Administration of Film and Television Right. # Berlinale Juries: ‘Rental Family’ Director Hikari; Producers Ewa Puszczyńska & Reinaldo Marcus Green Join Wim Wenders On Competition Jury

The Berlin Film Festival has unveiled the members of the jury who will join its president Wim Wenders in deciding which of the 22 films in Competition at this year’s edition will take home the Golden and Silver Bears. [...] They are director and producer Min Bahadur Bham (Nepal), actor Bae Doona (South Korea), director, producer and archivist Shivendra Singh Dungarpur (India), director, screenwriter and producer Reinaldo Marcus Green (USA), director, screenwriter and producer HIKARI (Japan) and producer Ewa Puszczyńska (Poland).

The competition jury will decide the winners of Golden Bear for Best Film (awarded to the film’s producers) as well as Silver Bears for the Grand Jury Prize, Jury Prize, Best Director, Best Leading Performance, Best Supporting Performance, Best Screenplay and Outstanding Artistic Contribution.
